Dear Mr. Ziomkowski:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
July 29, 2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Two of three new employee records reviewed had one of the three references as a
relative which is not permissible.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
08/28/2020 Renewal; CAP approved 09/14/2020
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance
within 30 days of the completion of the probationary period
or within 180 days, whichever is less, and a written
evaluation of the employee’s performance annually
thereafter.
Two of six employee records reviewed did not have performance evaluations
completed.
R 400.4139 Driver's License
The institution shall document that the driver of any vehicle
transporting residents at the request of or on behalf of the
licensee shall be an adult and possess a valid operator or
chauffeur license with endorsement appropriate to the vehicle
driven and the circumstances of its use.
Two of six employee records had expired driver’s licenses.
4

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
The facility does not serve a population that is covered under the MISEP. This
program serves a population of Unaccompanied Refugee Minors and Undocumented
Children that are under federal contract and state contract monitored by Office of
Refugee Resettlement (ORR).
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
The state contract held by this program is monitored through ORR.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Interviews with youth and staff were conducted. Youth reported feeling safe and
having their needs met. The youth discussed various outings and activities at the
house and that they enjoyed being active. Staff reported feeling supported, heard
and having the tools to do their jobs.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
